text: The Australia women's national under–21 field hockey team, represents Australia in international under–21 field hockey and at the Junior World Cup. The team is controlled by the governing body for field hockey in Australia, Hockey Australia, which is currently a member of the Oceania Hockey Federation (OHF) and the International Hockey Federation (FIH). The team's official nickname is the Jillaroos. The team's first recorded appearance was at the 1993 Junior World Cup, where the team won a silver medal. The team's last appearance was during a test series against New Zealand in Hastings, New Zealand from November–December 2018. ==History== ===Tournament Records=== {| class="wikitable"
